text: is a Japanese Shinto shrine in Tokyo. It honors the spirits of Emperor Meiji and his wife, Empress Shōken.Japan-guide.com, Shrine"; Meiji jingū, "Introduction"; retrieved 2012-6-13. ==History== After the emperor's death in 1912, the Diet of Japan voted to commemorate his role in the Meiji Restoration."Meiji Shrine"; retrieved 2012-6-13. Work began on the shrine in 1915. It was formally dedicated in 1920; and it was completed in 1921. The grounds of the shrine were finished by 1926. Trees in the park were donated by people from all parts of Japan.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Meiji-jingū" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 624. Until 1946, the Meiji Shrine was in the .Ponsonby-Fane, Richard. (1959). The Imperial House of Japan, pp. 126. ==References== ==Other websites== * Meiji jingū website * Meiji Shrine map * Meiji Shrine panorama Category:Shinto shrines in Tokyo Category:Kanpei-taisha Category:Chokusaisha
title: Meiji Shrine
